title: V/H/S/85
review: This one is full of 80s attitude, fashion, and recreational activities. One segment has a particularly psychological aspect to the gore, relating to how it would feel to survive being horribly mutilated after the pain has subsided. I will look forward to each year's new {V/H/S} now. This one doesn't have anything super memorable, but they're all decent enough, and sometimes an anthology without any weak points can seem great.
spoilers: I loved having a callback to an earlier segment. I was expecting it because of the cliffhanger it initially ends on, but I was still excited when it happened.
